oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Confederate States of America -- Appropriations and expenditures; Confederate States of America -- Army; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1865-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Office of Subst Army of Tenn January 22 1864 Circular In consequence of the scarcity of meat ration a daily issue of one fourth of one pound of Grits to the ration will be Made to the troops of this army from & after this date until further orders W. E. Moore Major To Capt. B. J. Semmes acs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten report from the Army of Tennessee Office of Subsistence discussing the scarcity of meat rations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistnence Bureau
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of the most vexing problems faced by the Confederacy during the Civil War was obtaining sufficient food for its armies. It was a problem which grew steadily worse as the war continued, making the position of Commissary-General crucial. Early Confederate Army Regulations created the Office of Subsistence to procure subsistence stores for the army through contracts.
